lexUnit.name: taste.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sample or test the flavour of

sentence.text: The bottle you tasted six months ago is now softer and more appealing ; the one you drank yesterday should have lost its sharp edges by the summer .
` D' you know , the first time I tasted melon was n't till I was well over twenty ?

During the weekend , Westons Cider will be open for tasting what used to be known as the wine of the West .
Taste honey fresh straight from the hive !
For example , the snake uses its forked tongue to gather scent particles from the air and tastes them on a special membrane , called Jacobson 's organ , at the back of its mouth .
His mouth , sober just a minute ago , had drifted into a lazy smile , and she wanted to taste those freckles on his nose with her tongue .
Farrell closed his eyes as he tasted the rotting matter on his tongue .
These fleshy appendages are used to detect and taste food amongst the weed and debris on the bottom of a river .

This is one of those creamy frostings that seems to disappear on its way to the cake , simply because it 's so darn hard to keep from tasting it to death .
Ruth had never tasted ice-cream before coming to America and now , like Anna , she could have eaten it all day long .
Jean-Claude had never tasted steamed puddings before and he liked them .
He put it to his mouth and tasted it , then looked back at Wang Sau-leyan , his ancient face creased into a smile .
Pinot Noir red Alsace wines are unusual , to say the least , but if you get a chance to taste one , take it !
She made the kind of face she made when tasting sour milk .
While nothing quite beats actually tasting the wine , there are various terms on the neck of the bottle or the label that will help inform your choice .
Samples of wine were tasted to demonstrate what made a ` good " wine .
